word.description: {高} is *high*, {山} is *mountain*, and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea), so {阿里山} is *high mountain tea*.

description: [High mountain tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-mountain_tea) is oolong tea grown, surprise, high in the mountains of central Taiwan.

word.Yale: a léih sāan gōu sāan chàh
word.Pinyin: Ā lǐ Shān gāo shān chá
word.description: {阿里山} is the name [Alishan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alishan,_Chiayi) (notice the third character is the same character for *mountain* as the second character for *high mountain* {高山}.

images.place: Tea and Whisk, Las Vegas, Nevada

description: The most famous [high mountain tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-mountain_tea) is grown in the Alishan mountain range of Taiwan.

word.description: {貴妃} is the title of a high-ranking imperial concubine, in this case referring to the famous (or infamous) [Yang Gui Feng](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yang_Guifei). {烏龍} is *black dragon*, and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea), so {烏龍茶} is *black dragon tea*, and *貴妃烏龍茶* is *imperial concubine black dragon tea*.

images.place: Tea Zaanti, Salt Lake City, Utah

description: Gui fei oolong tea (gui fei is the Mandarin pronunciation), from the mountainous [Nantou County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nantou_County) in Taiwan, is a [beauty tea](https://teaepicure.com/oriental-beauty-bug-bitten-teas/), ironically brewed from leaves that have been nibbled upon by bugs, which induces a healing reaction that imparts a sweetened flavor.
